roleset.name: act, work, performance of a service
roleset.note: SERVE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'serve' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Comparison to 'work'. Member of Vncls masquerade-29.6-2, spend_time-104. (from serve-v.01)
SERVICE-N NOTES: Roleset based on serve-v.01, service-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls masquerade-29.6, spend_time-104. (from service-n.01)

role.descr: worker, entity performing a service/acting in some capacity

example.name: just employer
example.text: Each new trading roadblock is likely to be beaten by institutions-1 seeking better ways *trace*-1 to serve their high-volume clients, here or overseas.

example.name: just job
example.text: Mr. Reupke was one of three executives on Reuters's eight-person executive committee who-1 *trace*-1 didn't also serve on the company's board of directors.
example.arg: on the company's board of directors

example.name: job and employer
example.text: He has never met Lynn Williams, the president of the United Steelworkers union, and isn't active in the industry's main trade group, the American Iron and Steel Institute, which-1 Mr. Roderick served *trace*-1 as chairman.
example.arg: which -> the American Iron and Steel Institute

example.name: job as pro-controlled S
example.text: In a statement, Arnold B. McKinnon, chairman and chief executive officer, noted that the new repurchase program ``should serve to enhance shareholder value.''

example.name: nominal rel: serving
example.text: His serving as CTO for many years had given him great insight into the dynamics of small companies.

example.name: nominal rel: service
example.text: The service of security

example.name: nominal rel: service
example.text: His exemplary service as Secretary of Commerce

example.name: nominal rel: service
example.text: a company that provides disaster recovery services forcomputer-dependent businesses

example.name: nominal rel: service
example.text: Mike raised $35000 for Help For Heroes, a charity that is close to his heart following his ten year service in the British Army.

example.name: nominal rel: service
example.text: Community service

roleset.name: cater (to someone or something), delivery of something concrete
roleset.note: SERVE-V NOTES: Member of Vncls fulfilling-13.4.1-1. Updated by Julia, 11/2010. (from serve-v.02)
SERVICE-N NOTES: Roleset based on serve-v.02. Corresponds to VNcls fulfilling-13.4.1-1. (from service-n.02)

example.name: breakfast in bed
example.text: John served runny eggs and burnt toast to Mary.

example.name: nominal rel: serving
example.text: Her serving popcorn all day caused her to go home smelling like butter substitute.

example.name: nominal rel: service
example.text: For that reason, the service of legal documents on the premises of the trade show has been prohibited.
example.arg: on the premises of the trade show

example.name: nominal rel: service
example.text: Proof of service of divorce papers to someone in jail in florida
example.arg: to someone in jail in Florida

example.name: nominal rel: service
example.text: A part of the Hotel-Villa BB is Adria tavern where we offer service of breakfast to our guests

roleset.name: serve a sentence
roleset.note: SERVE-V NOTES: Added by Julia (from serve-v.04)

role.descr: sentence served (maybe given as a period of time)

example.name: args 0, 1
example.text: ...no one...wanted her to serve prison time more than myself.

roleset.name: provide, offer
roleset.note: SERVE-V NOTES: No direct Vncls, but see fulfilling-13.4.1-1. (from serve-v.03)

example.name: unmentioned beneficiary
example.text: [*-2]-1 Served [*-1] up as a solo, however, [the music]-2 lacks the resonance provided by a context within another medium.

example.name: nominal rel: serving
example.text: Their serving up pancakes late into the afternoon caught the lodge many customers straight off the slope.

roleset.name: do things to, like maintenance
roleset.note: SERVICE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'service' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No Verbnet entry, no Framenet entry. (from service-v.01)
SERVICE-N NOTES: Added by Julia during unification.

role.descr: kind of service (thing done to arg1)

example.name: financial usage; verbal rel: service
example.text: [Maryland National Bank's retail finance]-1 division will continue *pro*-1 to service the loans.

example.name: nonfinancial usage: verbal rel: service
example.text: John serviced Mary's car.

example.name: nominal rel: service; arg2
example.text: It has been going in for oil change service every 2.5k miles.

roleset.name: religious service or ceremony
roleset.note: SERVICE-N NOTES: Roleset loosely based on celebrate.01. Verbnet class judgement-33. Framed by Katie. (from service.03-n)

role.descr: explicit mention of entity honored at the service

example.name: Example with arg 1 as religious service
example.text: Thirty-five percent attend religious services regularly

example.name: example with arg 1 and 2
example.text: More than 100 people their wedding service .
